name: Riad Al Massarah

reviews.text: No point spending long on this; all the other reviews sum up Riad al Massarah perfectly.
reviews.title: Wonderful in every regard!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The riad itself was stunning; beautifully decorated and pristine. Our room (upgraded, many thanks again!) was extremely comfortable, with a fantastic bathroom. The roof terrace was bliss in the morning, with its vista of the Atlas mountains in the distance. Breakfast was wonderful (the eggs were perfect every time!). The ground floor was equally as enchanting with the alluring pool and loungers. All very Conde Nast Traveller!
reviews.title: Truly a little slice of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: David looked after us incredibly well (the owners were unfortunately away during our visit) and in fact all of the staff were attentive, but not intrusive which was perfectly balanced. We were extremely impressed with the service.
reviews.title: Highly recommended to couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the riad on our first evening which was very tasty and good value for money. Generous portions too! The riad also booked us into Al Fassia one night which we loved and would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: A very welcoming and calm retreat in the middle of a unique city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a perfect stay, we hope to visit again and urge anyone thinking about booking to go for it!
reviews.title: A peaceful haven in the middle of Marrakech madness

reviews.text: This is a beautiful Riad. The owners have clearly put a lot of effort in to making this an oasis of calm in the middle of Marrakech madness. They made us feel welcome and were full of advice and tips, recommending great restaurants.
reviews.title: Beautiful Riad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spotless and staff were very friendly. The breakfast was excellent with home made yoghurt being served.
reviews.title: Magical Riad with exceptional service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of location, the Riad is conveniently located 20 mins walk from both the old and new town areas. It is not in a very touristy part but locals seemed to just regard us with interest rather than pound signs in their eyes, like they do in the souks.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a four day trip to Marrakech and it was our stay at the Riad Al Massarah which made our trip truly special!
reviews.title: Way surpassed expectations

reviews.text: The Riad has been beautifully renovated by the owners Michel and Michael, who have put their heart and soul into creating a tranquil, luxurious and welcoming oasis in a fascinating corner of the old town. The Riad has just 6 beautifully designed and well proportioned rooms, and there are plenty of spaces to relax;, whether on the roof terrace ( wondeful to hear the call to prayer from up here), the peaceful courtyard, the balcony's, the hamman (I had a very relaxing massage here by Maria) or the very cool and shaded lounge. There is a vast selection of books in the lounge exploring everything from Moroccan culture, religion, architecture, art and politics as well as some great classics. I would strongly recommend sampling the food in the Riad, the chef Abdel-Waheed is really fantastic; our favourite meal in Marrakech was here.
reviews.title: Fantastic Riad in the centre of the Medina

reviews.text: I've lived in Asia and Europe for over 20 years and have traveled extensively. Thus, the fact that the Riad Al Massarah made such a lasting impression is worth noting. Michael and Michel have perfected their roles as extrordinary hosts and their staff was equally as accommodating and charming. Guests immediately felt welcomed, pampered, and very special. From the gorgeous, peaceful interior spaces, to the fabulous meals, spa options, and amazing excursions offered....memorable moments were created at every turn.
reviews.title: Marrakech was fascinating, but the only reason I'd return, would be to stay at the Riad Al Massarah once again.

reviews.text: Had an incredibly enjoyable stay at Riad al Massarah. The location is incredible - you are right in the middle of the medina, but you still have the peace and quiet of the Riad. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bathrooms are very comfortable. The rooftop breakfasts are lovely. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly but also knew how to leave you alone when you wanted peace and quiet. The arranged for all tours and transfers without any issues. I would definitely stay here again. I had an amazing time.
reviews.title: Perfect location - friendly staff
We would give it six stars if we could
reviews.text: We stayed at the excellent Riad Al Massarah and could not recommend it highly enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an incredibly beautiful Riad that is stylishly decorated with lots of lovely areas in which to relax - whether on the rooftop terrace in the good weather or in the cosy lounge area with log fire if it's a bit more chilly.
reviews.title: A perfect oasis....

reviews.text: In addition to this, the service was impeccable. The owners went out of their way to give us helpful advice before arriving - and then provided us with an excellent orientation on our first day. They were always available to provide top insider tips on good places to eat and shop during our stay.
reviews.title: A haven of peace in a frantic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful - they were large, the beds very comfortable, and the water-pressure in the shower brilliant.
reviews.title: a real gem! cant wait to return!
Fantastic calm and relaxing place to saty
reviews.text: The staff were all very polite, friendly, and prompt in their duties. The food was delicious!!
The web site does not do the place justice.
reviews.title: The Riad al Massarah was the highlight of our stay!!

reviews.text: Excellent very well placed Riad and the owners Michael and Michel are warm, welcoming and very informative.
reviews.title: Riad Al Massarah... a place, a time and an experience I will cherrish forever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent, and breakfast on the terrace wonderful. We were lucky enough to have the terrace room so could enjoy the night time sights and sounds from the roof.
reviews.title: Perfection.

description: Responsibly run Riad with La Clef Verte accreditation and Travel Life Gold Award for sustainable tourism.
